summary: This adds a Viking longhouse based player home to The whistling mine area (winterhold) Requires Latest skyrim patch.
descriptionHtml:
Like this page for latest updates on whats happening: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Jiubiizeekks-Skyrim-mods/146300595538178

This adds a Viking longhouse based player home to The whistling mine area (winterhold) This one comes with a more nordic theme to it. This is located at The Whistling mine in the Winterhold - hold. so if anything edits the mine (directly outside) it wont be compatible with this.

Fully navmeshed inside and edited navmesh outside.

Lots of follower support - 4 beds (also one more downstairs) sweeping idol markers, wall lean markers, siting cross-legged marker, chairs Ect.

[b]To get inside!![/b]
New to Version 2.0 You must be thane of Winterhold, once you have acquired this rank you must goto the Mine owner 'Thorgar' and he should now have a shop which sells you the deeds to house items.

Inside:
3-4 bookshelf's (they hold a decent amount of books)
3 weapon racks.
7 weapon plaques.
4 mannequins.
5 beds.
1 cooking pot.
1 alchemy lab.
1 enchanters lab.
1 fireplace.
and much much more.
Secret not so secret, secret room.

Plenty of storage for all your armors and findings. New to V2.0 Cloud Storage containers That you will find in the House, In the Archmages quarters and Just outside the Inn (Winterhold).

2-3? Story's - (downstairs players bedroom, 3 mannequins, plenty of storage and enchanters laboratory)

[youtube]zL5bKDNvXLA[/youtube]


IF YOU HAVE A SUGGESTION'S PLEASE TELL ME!

Installation:
Download with NMM or
Install manually by finding your Skyrim/data directory and extracting contents there.
Requires latest skyrim BETA patch. 1.9 + (sorry about this its a Habbit)

Uninstallation:
Either with NMM or
delete contents of The download from your skyrim/data directory

Reinstall:??
If installing the latest version i recomend removing all your items from the house before you upgrade.
Also do a freshinstall, so disable the mod load up your save, then save, quit the game then put the latest one back in. That way here shouldn't be any bugs.


Credits:
Bethsda for making skyrim.
Skyrim.nexus for being the best modding community ever!

permissions:
None.
if you want to translate this please personal message me and ill give you an answer.

MY OTHER MOD
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27510/]Nine Bards Of Skyrim[/url]
MY OTHER MOD
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/30137/]Ji's Npc Immersion[/url]
My other mod
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26784]viking longhouse - Halrafn[/url]

Facebook Page Please like:
[url=http://www.facebook.com/pages/Jiubiizeekks-Skyrim-mods/146300595538178]JiubiIzeekk's skyrim mods[/url]
author: JiubiIzeekk

files.name: Cleaned with tes5edit Main file Withe mannequins
files.fileName: Cleaned with tes5edit Main file Withe mannequins -33008-V1-2.rar

files.name: Viking Longhouse Lofstrom Version 2
files.changelogHtml:
Reinstall:
If installing the latest version i recomend removing all your items from the house before you upgrade.
Also do a freshinstall, so disable the mod load up your save, then save, quit the game then put the latest one back in. That way here shouldn't be any bugs.


Version 2.0
So many new features =)

There is a new room
New scripts that make the house more fun and lore friendly ish.

To Obtain the house now is if you become thane of Winterhold you can buy the Deed to the house, to get the deed you have to goto The whistling mine and look for the boss, who will now have a shop available where you can buy the house and various upgrades. If this fails to work for you please skip to the end of this note.

mannequins:

if you do purchase the Enable mannequin book please don't be to fazed if you see them walking around. just leave the house and come back in and they wont be moving at all. And if you don't want to leave please just activate them.

Cloud storage chest next to the door. There is one in This House and One In the archmage's quarters And One Just outside the Inn in Winterhold.

*Spoiler*
*Spoiler*
*Spoiler*
Ok so Either you are to poor to afford the house, or your to stingy with your dragonborn money, and yes I know it can stack up to 100k + quite easily. or it genuinely isn't working for you.
Anyhow if it isn't working there is two chests Hidden. one is under the exterior of the Longhouse, and the other is In whistling Under the floor Near the Log's Kettle and Broom.

To get to these places open up the console [ ` ] and type TLC , and go on right through the floor or wall and loot the chest.
